definition: true or false?/correct or incorrect/to correct errors (in a document)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: There are no right or wrong answers in mobile.
sentences.chinese: 在移動業務裏沒有正誤。

sentences.english: Read the passage again. Find out the details to tell T or F.
sentences.chinese: 再次閱讀，找出細節判斷下列句子的正誤。

sentences.english: There are mistakes in the errata, which means that the quality of this publication is not good.
sentences.chinese: 正誤表中還有錯誤，說明此刊物質量不好。

sentences.english: The contrast between right and wrong is highlighted by the benefits accruing from the former .
sentences.chinese: 由於正確而得到的好處更加強調了正誤的對比。

sentences.english: A keen awareness of right from wrong is essential for determining appropriate social behavior .
sentences.chinese: 對正誤的深刻熟悉是判定得體的社會舉動所必需的。

sentences.english: And therefore the correcrness of the notes always capture the attention of the academic circles.
sentences.chinese: 因此，註釋的正誤也成了學術界關注的焦點之一。

sentences.english: I can't tell right from wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我再也無法辨別正誤對錯。

sentences.english: The contrast between right and wrong is highlighted by the benefits accruing from the former.
sentences.chinese: 由於正確而得到的好處更加強調了正誤的對比。

sentences.english: Read the text carefully and decide if the statements are true or false.
sentences.chinese: 細讀課文，從文章中找出句子，分析意思並判斷正誤。
